CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph. PBDT-TDPP-S is the electron donor and PC71BM is the electron acceptor in the context of polymer solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. PC71BM

These are the relevant material names in the paragraph. I have removed other irrelevant entities such as "polymer solar cells," "electron donor," and "electron acceptor" which are not material names but roles or types of materials.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is a "Property Name" entity, as it refers to a specific type of electron donor used in the solar cells.
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM): This is another "Property Name" entity, as it refers to a specific type of electron acceptor used in the solar cells.
3. power conversion efficiency: This is a "Property Name" entity, as it refers to a specific property of the solar cells.
4. 4.89%: This is a value associated with the "Property Name" entity "power conversion efficiency."
5. open-circuit voltage: This is a "Property Name" entity, as it refers to another specific property of the solar cells.
6. 0.84 V: This is a value associated with the "Property Name" entity "open-circuit voltage."
7. short-circuit current: This is a "Property Name" entity, as it refers to another specific property of the solar cells.
8. 10.04 mA cm^-2: This is a value associated with the "Property Name" entity "short-circuit current."
9. fill factor: This is a "Property Name" entity, as it refers to another specific property of the solar cells.
10. 56.0%: This is a value associated with the "Property Name" entity "fill factor."
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is a Material Property entity, as it refers to a specific type of electron donor material used in the solar cells.
2. PC71BM: This is a Material Property entity, as it refers to a specific type of electron acceptor material used in the solar cells.
3. power conversion efficiency: This is a Material Property entity, as it refers to a specific property of the solar cell material.
4. open-circuit voltage: This is a Material Property entity, as it refers to a specific property of the solar cell material.
5. short-circuit current: This is a Material Property entity, as it refers to a specific property of the solar cell material.
6. fill factor: This is a Material Property entity, as it refers to a specific property of the solar cell material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |
| power conversion efficiency |
| 4.89% |
| open-circuit voltage |
| 0.84 V |
| short-circuit current |
| 10.04 mA cm^-2 |
| fill factor |
| 56.0% |

Note: I have included the values associated with the property names as well, as they are also mentioned in the original paragraph and provide important context for the property names. However, if the task is strictly to identify only the property names, then the table can be modified to exclude the values.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. "power conversion efficiency of 4.89%" - Here, "4.89%" is the "Property Value" referring to the efficiency of the solar cells.
2. "an open-circuit voltage of 0.84 V" - Here, "0.84 V" is the "Property Value" referring to the voltage generated in the solar cells when no current is flowing.
3. "a short-circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2" - Here, "10.04 mA cm^-2" is the "Property Value" referring to the current generated in the solar cells when the voltage is zero.
4. "a fill factor of 56.0%" - Here, "56.0%" is the "Property Value" referring to the ratio of the maximum power that a solar cell can deliver to the product of its open-circuit voltage and short-circuit current.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. "4.89%" (power conversion efficiency)
2. "0.84 V" (open-circuit voltage)
3. "10.04 mA cm^-2" (short-circuit current)
4. "56.0%" (fill factor)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4.89% (power conversion efficiency) |
| 0.84 V (open-circuit voltage) |
| 10.04 mA cm^-2 (short-circuit current) |
| 56.0% (fill factor) |
